column5: Ok perviacs it's not a new John Hughes movie---I've been asked to give updates on the art project.  Got the felt and rope/braid on skull cap---just need the back wall plaque and she's finis.  Bushart
That's incredible!  Way to go.  What do you plan on doing with the finished piece?
That is a piece of "ART WORK" Bush. Thanks to you for shareing it with us.
WOW, that is so beautiful!!!!! I love it!
Looks great man .. i wish I could do that .. stick figures is all I ever mastered

Thanks Guys  Like I said a while back it's tougher than it looks---you kinda have to have your picture flow with the curves in the antler.  And the antler itself being full of vein ridges makes it extra hard to be precise---definetly takes more beer  I need to acquire now a nice back wall plaque and attach them and it will be complete.  I have a few more moose sets in the shed but I think I'll wait awhile befor I do another.  Bushart
You have done a very good job. Kenny G.
Bush...that piece is beutiful.  I can only imagine what it is like to paint on those antlers.  Very nice job  Cheers  Craig
I must say, that is AWESOME!!!  Just curious, how much would it cost to have something like that done? That would make an awesome gift for someone special!!!  S.

Lets say it would have to be someone very special --cause it's a lot of work---antlers are touchy biz with mnr when it comes to selling them---I've been told by the mnr-- the value of the art must exceed the value of the antler  Anyway at the end of the day your buying the artwork and the antler is free. If I understand correctly
Great piece of work!  Quite unique, difficult enough just to paint, but on antlers WOW!  Thanks for posting this, ehg
Excellent work and craftsmanship bushart Take a bow... you deserve it Thanks for the update and keep up to awesome work!!! Leechman
